type.name: section
type.title: Short title and commencement.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Short title and commencement. 1. This Act may be cited as the Rice Factories Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Rice Factories Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Interpretation. 2. In this Act  Board means the Guyana Rice Development Board established by section 3 of the Guyana Rice Development Board Act.  district means a district declared and established by the Minister under section 2 of the District Government Act;  licence means a licence issued to person under section 4;  licensee means a person to whom a licence has been issued;   manufacture  of  rice  means  the  use  of  any  process  in connection with the converting of paddy into rice;  official paddy grading agency means a facility authorised by the Board under section
type.description: In this Act  Board means the Guyana Rice Development Board established by section 3 of the Guyana Rice Development Board Act.  district means a district declared and established by the Minister under section 2 of the District Government Act;  licence means a licence issued to person under section 4;  licensee means a person to whom a licence has been issued;   manufacture  of  rice  means  the  use  of  any  process  in connection with the converting of paddy into rice;  official paddy grading agency means a facility authorised by the Board under section

type.name: section
type.title: Application for permit to establish rice factory.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Application for permit to establish rice factory. 3. (1) A person who desires to establish a rice factory shall apply to the Board for permit to do so in triplicate accompanied by  (a) the building plans  (b) the certificate of title, lease or any other document evidencing title or a right of occupancy of the land;  (c) an environmental permit from the Environmental Protection Agency established under the Environmental Protection Act or a statement from the Agency to the effect that the applicant has been exempted from the requirement for an environmental impact assessment;  LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 95:05 Rice Factories  L.R.O. 1/2012                             Fifth Schedule.    Rice not to be manufactured without licence. [3 of 2007]        Sixth Schedule.         (d) the application fee (if any) prescribed by regulation.  (2) The Board upon receipt of the fee (if any) prescribed under subsection (1)(d) and documents referred to in subsection (1) shall transmit copies of those documents to the Central Housing and Planning Authority, the Central Board of Health, the Factories Division of the Occupational Health and Safety Department, the Environmental Protection Agency and the Department of Fire Service for their consideration and recommendations.  (3) The Board shall, notwithstanding anything in any other written law, upon receipt of the recommendations of the entities to which the documents were transmitted and taking those recommendations into consideration decide whether or not a permit should be granted for the rice factory to be established.  (4) The Board shall issue a permit under this section, where the applicant satisfies generally the requirements for rice factories specified in the Fifth schedule.

Rice not to be manufactured without licence. [3 of 2007]        Sixth Schedule.

The Board shall, notwithstanding anything in any other written law, upon receipt of the recommendations of the entities to which the documents were transmitted and taking those recommendations into consideration decide whether or not a permit should be granted for the rice factory to be established.
The Board shall issue a permit under this section, where the applicant satisfies generally the requirements for rice factories specified in the Fifth schedule.

type.name: section
type.title: Rice not to be manufactured without licence.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Rice not to be manufactured without licence. 4. (1) No person shall manufacture rice unless, upon an application therefor in the Form in the First Schedule, he is issued with a licence by the Board.  (2) In any case where a producer sells paddy to a manufacturer  (a) the manufacturer shall ensure that the sale is evidenced in writing, in the Form in the Sixth Schedule; and  (b) the manufacturer shall pay the producer interest for any late payment, as specified in that form.  (3) Any person who contravenes subsection (1) or LAWS OF GUYANA Rice Factories Cap. 95:05 7  L.R.O. 1/2012                        Second Schedule.      Refusal to issue licence.    Appeal against refusal to issue licence.               (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable, on summary conviction  (a) for a first offence, to a fine of five hundred thousand dollars and in the case of continuing offence a further fine of one thousand dollars for each day during which the offence continues.  (b) for a second or subsequent offence, to a fine of five hundred thousand dollars and imprisonment for six months, and in the case of a continuing offence to a further fine of one thousand dollars for every day during which the offence continues.  (4) A licence shall be in the Form in the Second Schedule and shall be subject to the attached thereto.

shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable, on summary conviction

Any person who contravenes subsection
A licence shall be in the Form in the Second Schedule and shall be subject to the attached thereto.

type.name: section
type.title: Refusal to issue licence.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Refusal to issue licence. 5. The Board may refuse to issue a licence to any applicant who in the five-year period immediately preceding his application was convicted of an offence under this Act.
type.description: The Board may refuse to issue a licence to any applicant who in the five-year period immediately preceding his application was convicted of an offence under this Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Appeal against refusal to issue licence.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Appeal against refusal to issue licence. 6. (1) An applicant who is aggrieved by a decision of the Board refusing to issue a licence may, within thirty days of the date of being notified of the decision, appeal in writing to the Minister and within the same period furnish to the Board a copy of his appeal.  (2) An appeal shall contain the facts and arguments upon which the aggrieved applicant relies.  (3) The Board shall, within fourteen days from the date of receipt of a copy of the appeal, submit to the Minister the reasons for refusal to issue the licence.  (4) The Minister may, after considering the appeal LAWS OF GUYANA 8 Cap. 95:05 Rice Factories  L.R.O. 1/2012     Forms and fees for licences. Second Schedule.                                  Revocation of licences.                  and the reasons furnished by the Board, order the Board to issue the licence.

description.description: An applicant who is aggrieved by a decision of the Board refusing to issue a licence may, within thirty days of the date of being notified of the decision, appeal in writing to the Minister and within the same period furnish to the Board a copy of his appeal.
An appeal shall contain the facts and arguments upon which the aggrieved applicant relies.
The Board shall, within fourteen days from the date of receipt of a copy of the appeal, submit to the Minister the reasons for refusal to issue the licence.

The Minister may, after considering the appeal LAWS OF GUYANA 8 Cap. 95:05 Rice Factories  L.R.O. 1/2012     Forms and fees for licences. Second Schedule.                                  Revocation of licences.                  and the reasons furnished by the Board, order the Board to issue the licence.

type.name: section
type.title: Form and fees for licences
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Form and fees for licences 7. (1) A licence shall be in the Form in the Second Schedule and shall expire on 31st December in every year.  (2) The following licence fees shall be paid annually for a rice factory having a  Fees $ (a) milling capacity not exceeding two tons 25,000 (b) milling capacity exceeding two tons but not exceeding five tons 40,000 (c) milling capacity exceeding five tons but not exceeding ten tons 80,000 (d) milling capacity exceeding ten tons 100,000  (3) Where a licence is issued for the time on any date after 1st July, the licence fee shall be halved.  (4) The Minister may by order increase or decrease the fees prescribed under subsection (2).

description.description: A licence shall be in the Form in the Second Schedule and shall expire on 31st December in every year.
The following licence fees shall be paid annually for a rice factory having a  Fees $
milling capacity not exceeding two tons 25,000
milling capacity exceeding two tons but not exceeding five tons 40,000
milling capacity exceeding five tons but not exceeding ten tons 80,000
milling capacity exceeding ten tons 100,000
Where a licence is issued for the time on any date after 1st July, the licence fee shall be halved.
The Minister may by order increase or decrease the fees prescribed under subsection

type.name: section
type.title: Revocation of licences
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Revocation of licences 8. (1)The board may revoke or suspend a licence where the holder thereof commits a breach of any of the terms and conditions of the licence or contravenes any of the provisions of this Act or any regulations made thereunder.  (2) Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the Board may revoke or suspend a licence where the holder  (a) fails to comply with requirements relating to  (i) the quality or grading of paddy or rice under any law; (ii) the manufacture of rice; LAWS OF GUYANA Rice Factories Cap. 95:05 9  L.R.O. 1/2012                                       Transfer of licence.                       Power to enter and inspect factory and examine books.             (b) produces rice or paddy for export by a person who is not a holder of an export licence:  (c) sells rice or paddy for which a quality certificate has not been issued under any law without approved packaging or approved labelling; or  (d) fails to maintain proper records of the rice or paddy entering and leaving his factory.  (3) The board shall, before revoking a licence, grant the holder thereof an opportunity of being heard.

description.description: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection
fails to comply with requirements relating to
the quality or grading of paddy or rice under any law;
produces rice or paddy for export by a person who is not a holder of an export licence:
sells rice or paddy for which a quality certificate has not been issued under any law without approved packaging or approved labelling; or
fails to maintain proper records of the rice or paddy entering and leaving his factory.
The board shall, before revoking a licence, grant the holder thereof an opportunity of being heard.

type.name: section
type.title: Transfer of licences.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Transfer of licences. 9. (1) A licence shall not be transferred except with the prior consent of the Board.  (2) Where a licensee wishes to transfer his licence to some other person, shall deliver to the Board an application in writing signed by himself and the proposed transferee and the Board may, where the proposed transferee qualifies for issue of a licence, endorse on the licence its consent to the transfer.

description.description: A licence shall not be transferred except with the prior consent of the Board.

Where a licensee wishes to transfer his licence to some other person, shall deliver to the Board an application in writing signed by himself and the proposed transferee and the Board may, where the proposed transferee qualifies for issue of a licence, endorse on the licence its consent to the transfer.

type.name: section
type.title: Power to enter and inspect factory and examine books.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Power to enter and inspect factory and examine books. 10. (1) The Chairman or the General Manager of the Board, or any person authorised in writing by or on behalf of the Board or the head of any of the entities referred to in section 3 (2) or anyone authorised in writing by or behalf of such head, may at all reasonable times enter a rice factory and inspect it or any paddy or rice therein or any books kept under this Act or any other books kept under this Act or any other written law.  (2) Any person who refuses to permit any person authorised by or under subsection (1) to do anything referred to therein shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to a LAWS OF GUYANA 10 Cap. 95:05 Rice Factories  L.R.O. 1/2012      Register of licences.        Official paddy grading agency.  Third Schedule.         Fourth Schedule.     Paddy to be bought or sold at 143lbs per bag.           Application of provision.    Prosecution of offences and recovery of penalties.  Regulations. [3 of 2007]       fine of one hundred thousand dollars and imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months.

type.name: section
type.title: Register of licences.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Register of licences. 11. The Board shall cause to be kept a register of licences issued by the board.
type.description: The Board shall cause to be kept a register of licences issued by the board.

type.name: section
type.title: Official paddy grading agency.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Official paddy grading agency. 12.  paddy means the unhulled product of the rice plant;  rice factory means any premises on which paddy is manufactured into rice by mechanical power; and includes any place, building, machinery or equipment used in connection with the storage of paddy or rice, or the manufacture of rice and includes rice milling facilities;  rice milling facility means premises, whether or not owned by the Government or any of its agencies LAWS OF GUYANA Rice Factories Cap. 95:05 5  L.R.O. 1/2012                          Application for permit to establish rice factory. [3 of 2007]              c. 20:05        (i) into which paddy or rice may be received directly from trucks,  trailers, ships  or other conveyances, or out of which paddy or rice may be discharged directly  into trucks, trailers, ships or other conveyances; (ii) constructed  for  the  purposes  of  handling,  storing  and processing paddy or rice received directly from producers, otherwise than as part of the farming  operation of a particular producer,  and which have services ancillary to milling including services for welfare of workers.

description.description: into which paddy or rice may be received directly from trucks,  trailers, ships  or other conveyances, or out of which paddy or rice may be discharged directly  into trucks, trailers, ships or other conveyances;

type.name: section
type.title: Paddy to be bought or sold at 143lbs per bag.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Paddy to be bought or sold at 143lbs per bag. 13. (1) No person shall sell, purchase or receive paddy for the manufacture of rice, except at a price calculated on a bag of one hundred and forty-three pounds net or such other weight as may be prescribed by the Minister by regulation.  (2) Any person who contravenes subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to fine of one hundred thousand dollars and imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months.

description.description: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to fine of one hundred thousand dollars and imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months.
Any person who contravenes subsection

type.name: section
type.title: Application of due process provisions.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Application of due process provisions. 14. Sections 5, 6, 8, 9, and 11 shall apply mutatis mutandis to a permit issued under section 3 and to an authorisation granted under section
type.description: Sections 5, 6, 8, 9, and 11 shall apply mutatis mutandis to a permit issued under section 3 and to an authorisation granted under section

type.name: section
type.title: Prosecution of offences and recovery of penalties.
type.context: RICE FACTORIES ACT under Prosecution of offences and recovery of penalties. 15. All offences and penalties under this Act may be prosecuted and recovered under the Summary Jurisdiction Acts.
type.description: All offences and penalties under this Act may be prosecuted and recovered under the Summary Jurisdiction Acts.
